programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.desc: Catch live G League action from the 2024-25 season

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Chris Jacobs' Porsche 911 Targa, a Purple Porsche 930, and a ZL1 Camaro clone
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs stops by to surprise Colin with his ""Daily"" 1985 Porsche 911 Targa and throws Colin for a loop.After that, Colin takes a look at a Porsche 930 Turbo tuned to ""outrun the cops,"" and a ZL1 clone Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: MODIFIED - An Overland Porsche Cayenne and 2 Wild H1 Hummers
programme.desc: Matt goes behind the scenes at E-Motion Engineering and checks out how subtle but functional modifications can transform a Cayenne daily driver into a purpose-built escape mobile. Next, Matt jumps into 2 heavily modified H1 Hummers.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa - Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86 and Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: 4-episode block of the award-winning "ICONS" series with Jason Cammisa featuring the Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86, and Ford Bronco Raptor.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | A trio of incredible Mercedes sports cars
programme.desc: Henry drives Mercedes’ SLS AMG Black Series and AMG GT Black Series, two of the wildest, rarest, most expensive cars ever to emerge from Affalterbach.Next, another famous Merc takes center stage as Henry reviews the McLaren Mercedes SLR HDK.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Expensive Toyotas, and the #1 GT-R Restoration Shop
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Chris Jacobs' Porsche 911 Targa, a Purple Porsche 930, and a ZL1 Camaro clone
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs stops by to surprise Colin with his ""Daily"" 1985 Porsche 911 Targa and throws Colin for a loop.After that, Colin takes a look at a Porsche 930 Turbo tuned to ""outrun the cops,"" and a ZL1 clone Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: MODIFIED - An Overland Porsche Cayenne and 2 Wild H1 Hummers
programme.desc: Matt goes behind the scenes at E-Motion Engineering and checks out how subtle but functional modifications can transform a Cayenne daily driver into a purpose-built escape mobile. Next, Matt jumps into 2 heavily modified H1 Hummers.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa - Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86 and Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: 4-episode block of the award-winning "ICONS" series with Jason Cammisa featuring the Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86, and Ford Bronco Raptor.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | A trio of incredible Mercedes sports cars
programme.desc: Henry drives Mercedes’ SLS AMG Black Series and AMG GT Black Series, two of the wildest, rarest, most expensive cars ever to emerge from Affalterbach.Next, another famous Merc takes center stage as Henry reviews the McLaren Mercedes SLR HDK.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Expensive Toyotas, and the #1 GT-R Restoration Shop
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: The Pittsburgh Steelers and Arizona Cardinals dueled in a Super Bowl for the ages that featured plenty of iconic moments. Arizona would not quit as they battled back from a 13-point fourth quarter deficit, only to see Big Ben Roethlisberger drive down the field and hit Santonio Holmes in the corner of the end zone for the game winning touchdown.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Curfew: Sins of the Father
programme.desc: Former police captain Thomas Cooper, once a respected figure, finds himself entangled in a dangerous deal with a notorious crime boss. His involvement leads to a love triangle and ultimately a betrayal. Now, haunted by his past, Thomas must confront the consequences when his son, Christian, becomes a target of the crime boss's revenge.

programme.title: Hoodie Girls Gang
programme.desc: Kayla's boyfriend Jamal is jailed and needs $10,000 bail. Desperate, Kayla and her friends plan an armed robbery. However, the heist goes wrong, and the police are on their trail. To make matters worse, Jamal's boss, Sean, demands payment for the drugs Jamal was transporting. Kayla must now free Jamal and escape town before both the police and Sean catch up to her.

programme.title: Thicker the Berry, the Sweeter the Juice
programme.desc: A plus-sized woman with no luck in the dating game finds her life taking a sharp turn when she gets involved with the neighborhood bad boy.

programme.title: Till Death Do Us
programme.desc: Marcus falls in love with Jessica, who has her own house and wants to start a family. Shortly after their honeymoon, Jessica's past life comes back in to the present. When Jessica's long lost husband reappears back in her life, and wants his family.

programme.title: Predatory Behavior
programme.desc: When women start disappearing all over the city, Detective Powell and Scott take on the case hoping to bring the culprit to justice. Can they find the elusive killer or will it be to late for the next victim.

programme.title: Princess of the Trap House
programme.desc: When a local drug dealer is arrested and put in jail, he asks his daughter Diamond to run his operation. However it doesn't sit well with the crew. Diamond must get rid of the disloyal members of the crew before they take control of the operation.

programme.title: Cheddy Ace
programme.desc: After being forced out of desperation to take out a “hood loan,” Cheddy Ace has just 24 hours to pay back a dangerous pair of thugs…or else.

programme.title: Captured
programme.desc: A woman discovers an old camera that causes whoever uses it to experience terrifying visions.

programme.title: Cake: A Second Slice
programme.desc: Ronnie gets in some dark-chocolate trouble when Heather falls in love with Carmen's unique brownie mix and Rick is in a troubling love triangle.

programme.title: Choppa City Queens
programme.desc: An unemployed woman strikes up a deal to sell a gunrunner's guns on the black market until her friend’s boyfriend decides he wants to take over.

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: When an unemployed actress finds herself broke and sleeping on her best friend's couch, she is forced to get a job as a substitute teacher working with one student. She soon realizes that it takes real super powers to deal with this classroom terror.

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: Movie to be disclosed.

programme.title: Curse of a Father
programme.desc: A father's horrible mistake causes a lifetime of pain for his children. His son tries his best to live a normal life, but his childhood trauma follows him into his marriage. He must face his trauma head on to break this generational curse.

programme.title: Kinfolk
programme.desc: Eboni is a hair stylist dreaming of owning a successful salon in her hometown, with the support of her half-siblings Beau and Hillary. Things get complicated when their father attempts to reconcile for the past.

programme.title: Dream on Dreamer
programme.desc: Mario's life unravels when he quits med school for acting, angering his wife, Erica, who leaves with their daughter. His friend Derrick faces his own crisis with his side chick. Desperate, they turn to Mario's drug-dealing brother, Paul. This leads them into the dangerous world of Queen Pin Malkia, where their lives are put at risk.

programme.title: Quiet as Kept
programme.desc: Jay is unlawfully detained. His ex-girlfriend returns, and his business partners work to clear his name. Meanwhile, a crooked cop is under suspicion for murder, and connections are made between him and Jay. Torn between duty and loyalty, Detective Johnson is caught in the middle. As the prosecution struggles, Jay and his business partners work to exist the dangerous world cleanly.

programme.title: The Special Affect
programme.desc: Expecting mother and artist, Destiny, spirals after a tragic loss. Her loving husband helps her cope, but a bad trip and missed meds spark disturbing memories. With the help of her best friend, Destiny uncovers a horrifying truth about her past.

programme.title: Roseland
programme.desc: The residents of Roseland try to convince wild-child Juju to slow down and change his reckless ways.

programme.title: Battered Emotions
programme.desc: Grappling with a breast cancer diagnosis, Rasheada fights to stay strong while her sister and best friend face their own personal battles.

programme.title: Bakerz Union
programme.desc: A hapless mail carrier and his bootlegger pal think they’ve struck green gold when they happen upon a lost shipment of marijuana in the mail.

programme.title: Battered Emotions 2
programme.desc: A pregnant woman makes the decision to leave her abusive boyfriend after an act of violence proves to be the last straw for their relationship.

programme.title: 1-800 Missing
programme.desc: After his daughter goes missing, Kevin Townsend, an undercover cop, makes it his mission to save her and the missing children of Chicago.

programme.title: Toxic King
programme.desc: Keeng is searching for love in all the wrong places. After years of trouble relationships, he decides to just be a playboy and become a "serial love hopper" that is until he reunites with Zuri, a college friend who he has always had a crush on.

programme.title: Deeper
programme.desc: A fallen kingpin seeks to reclaim his drug empire and place of power, as well as the woman he loves.

programme.title: Double Blended
programme.desc: Two married couples that were once married to each other's ex-spouse have pleasantly coped with a double blended family lifestyle until an upcoming event causes a disturbance.

programme.title: Deliveries From Eva
programme.desc: Finding he still has a fan, a disgraced music star forms an unlikely friendship with a delivery driver whose fandom grows into a dangerous obsession.

programme.title: American Girl
programme.desc: A young woman with political and social-justice aspirations finds herself trying to survive on the streets of Atlanta after running away from home.

programme.title: Mistress for Hire
programme.desc: Skylar works as a professional mistress hired by women for divorce leverage. When she finds herself falling for her target, Eric, she questions her career and her motives. But when Eric's wife, Octavia, won't allow Skylar to destroy her plans, and a dangerous game of cat and mouse ensues, with love and survival on the line.

programme.title: Dish Nation
programme.desc: Usher struggles to keep his abs and Eve thanks Nicki Minaj

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Winter Wipeout has the awards show to end all awards shows –The Snow Globes.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E04 - Real Fast Food

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E05 - Food on a Budget

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds a variety of herbs that thrive in shade to the herb garden and adds summer annuals to the cottage garden. Nick Bailey has taken a rare opportunity to design his town garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out tender vegetables for late summer harvests and gives tips on plants that thrive on a minimum of water when he plants up a pot of succulent plants. Frances Tophill demonstrates an unusual method of reducing weeds in her allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Kierti Vaidya's alpaca farm in Warwickshire that has run into difficulties.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Nick and Talitha, who hope to make a new life for themselves from two acres of land.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits city girl Jen and her country cousin Bek who have started a flower farm in Kent.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on growing tomatoes and has ideas of how to fill gaps in the garden once the flowers of spring are past their best. The team meet an extraordinary gardener from Swansea, whose upper limb difference has not deterred her.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to prune spring-flowering roses and makes successional sowings of vegetables to ensure continuous crops. Adam Frost gives tips on helping plants cope with drought conditions and shows how to save precious water.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives tips on how to keep the garden looking good as well as how to maintain the vegetable plot for continuous crops. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein gives a comprehensive and seasonal guide to getting plants for free and this time she turns her attention to popular climbers like honeysuckle and clematis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives more advice on tomato-growing, Nick Bailey travels to South Africa in search of the cousins of the Crocosmia, and Advolly Richmond looks at the Victorian trend of garden theme parks.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired army nurse Linda Powel wins a dream hunt in Texas hosted by Record Rack Deer feed. What's the catch? Linda has never hunted a day in her life!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark has knocked off all the waterfowl species for his Wingshooting Slam. Just two upland birds remain to complete the slam: Chukar and Pheasant. With a few days left in New Zealand, Mark starts his journey going after Chukar in the high country. He is accompanied by a local hunter who is taking him to an area where he has kicked a covey up in the past. They are in for a cold and brutal hike given the elevation and a storm moving in.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Veracruz, Mexico chasing after a free-range Axis Deer. With warmer temps still presenting challenges, Mark and his guide head to a Michon overlooking a pond full of crocodiles. With the temps getting as warm as 90 degrees, the Axis deer search for water to stay hydrated. With time running out on the final day, they catch movement in the brush and a beautiful Axis buck steps out to take a drink.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: saltwater experience

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Shot through the neck on Fort Hood in Texas, Green Beret John Arroyo recounts coming face to face with his attacker and Jesus blinding his would be killer.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Ginger Gilbert-Ravella honors the memory her husband…American hero Troy Gilbert.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With bow camp starting off strong at the Dirty Bird, Randy is feeling good about the rest of the week. Until Cody decides to head into town and places a small wager with a stranger.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's thrilling adventure in Tanzania continues as he sets his sights on the elusive Grant's Gazelle and the striking Fringe-Eared Oryx. Armed with his precision-engineered Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, Mark is poised to make every shot count. The real challenge lies not just in the accuracy of his aim but in getting close enough to these magnificent creatures.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired army nurse Linda Powel wins a dream hunt in Texas hosted by Record Rack Deer feed. What's the catch? Linda has never hunted a day in her life!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark has knocked off all the waterfowl species for his Wingshooting Slam. Just two upland birds remain to complete the slam: Chukar and Pheasant. With a few days left in New Zealand, Mark starts his journey going after Chukar in the high country. He is accompanied by a local hunter who is taking him to an area where he has kicked a covey up in the past. They are in for a cold and brutal hike given the elevation and a storm moving in.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Veracruz, Mexico chasing after a free-range Axis Deer. With warmer temps still presenting challenges, Mark and his guide head to a Michon overlooking a pond full of crocodiles. With the temps getting as warm as 90 degrees, the Axis deer search for water to stay hydrated. With time running out on the final day, they catch movement in the brush and a beautiful Axis buck steps out to take a drink.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's thrilling adventure in Tanzania continues as he sets his sights on the elusive Grant's Gazelle and the striking Fringe-Eared Oryx. Armed with his precision-engineered Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, Mark is poised to make every shot count. The real challenge lies not just in the accuracy of his aim but in getting close enough to these magnificent creatures.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.
