programme.desc: Jewel married a gun-totin' good ol' boy Green, with whom she has ostensibly never had sex. But when she meets rich kid Matt, it's love at first sight.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Murphy's Romance
programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorcée with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: Major League: Back to the Minors
programme.desc: Minor league pitcher Gus Cantrell (Scott Bakula) is about to be put out to pasture when he is given the opportunity to do the next best thing: manage the South Carolina Buzz. The ailing baseball team is full of terrible players, but owner Roger Dorn (Corbin Bernsen) is banking on Cantrell to make a top-notch franchise out of them. While trying to work miracles on the wacky lineup, Cantrell butts heads with the uppity manager of the Minnesota Twins, resolving their conflict on the field.

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: A young public relations exec goes on a remarkably disastrous blind date that threatens to upend his entire life while opening him up to true love.

programme.title: I Dreamed of Africa
programme.desc: A bored Italian socialite abandons her jet-set lifestyle for the rigors and rewards of rural Kenya in this true story based on a best-selling memoir.

programme.title: Heartsounds
programme.desc: A near-fatal heart attack sends a New York urologist and his writer wife into a battle against a medical institution unable or unwilling to help him.

programme.title: Calendar Girl
programme.desc: It's 1962 and three friends just out of high school journey to Hollywood determined to meet the object of their shared obsession: Marilyn Monroe.

programme.title: Nadine
programme.desc: While recovering sexy photos of herself from a dishonest photographer, a woman witnesses a murder and finds herself at the center of a conspiracy.

programme.title: Crazy in Alabama
programme.desc: Lucille, is an eccentric who goes to Hollywood to pursue her dreams. In tow is her nephew, Peejoe, an Alabama boy who's about to get a fast education.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager learns wisdom and self-control from an unorthodox karate master. With his new mentor's guidance, the boy faces down his fears.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II
programme.desc: After learning that his father is dying, karate master Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) returns home to Okinawa, bringing his protege, Daniel (Ralph Macchio), with him. In Japan, Miyagi is surprised to discover that his old sweetheart, Yukie (Nobu McCarthy), has remained single. Meanwhile, Daniel is attracted to Yukie's niece, Kumiko (Tamlyn Tomita). But romance must be put on hold while Daniel and Miyagi deal with local bullies and long-harbored grudges.

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: The story of a man looking to redeem himself by saving the life of America's highest elected official, even if it means sacrificing himself.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: After a murder inside the Louvre, symbolist Robert Langdon finds clues in Da Vinci’s paintings, which leads to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: When the idealistic young Jefferson Smith (James Stewart) winds up appointed to the United States Senate, he gains the mentorship of Senator Joseph Paine (Claude Rains). However, Paine isn't as noble as his reputation would indicate, and he becomes involved in a scheme to discredit Smith, who wants to build a boys' campsite where a more lucrative project could go. Determined to stand up against Paine and his corrupt peers, Smith takes his case to the Senate floor.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: All Ashore
programme.desc: When they finally get some shore leave, three sailors head to Catalina Island and try to meet girls while pretending to be entertainers.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: There's That Woman Again
programme.desc: A district-attorney employee worries about his wife's activities as an amateur sleuth.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Affair in Trinidad
programme.desc: At the cost of damaging her relationship, a club dancer secretly works in cahoots with the cops to extract intel from a gang of international spies.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: When the idealistic young Jefferson Smith (James Stewart) winds up appointed to the United States Senate, he gains the mentorship of Senator Joseph Paine (Claude Rains). However, Paine isn't as noble as his reputation would indicate, and he becomes involved in a scheme to discredit Smith, who wants to build a boys' campsite where a more lucrative project could go. Determined to stand up against Paine and his corrupt peers, Smith takes his case to the Senate floor.

programme.title: Bye Bye Birdie
programme.desc: When the draft selects rock star Conrad Birdie, his fans are devastated, but none more than struggling songwriter Albert Peterson (Dick Van Dyke), whose song Birdie was just about to record. Albert's longtime girlfriend, Rosie (Janet Leigh), pushes Albert to write a new tune that Birdie will perform on television to a fan selected in a contest. The scheme works, with young Ohio teenager Kim McAfee (Ann-Margret) declared the winner, but no one has counted on the jealous wrath of her boyfriend.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: The Amazing Mr. Williams
programme.desc: Homicide detective Kenny Williams (Melvyn Douglas) is so attached to his police work that his longtime fiancée, Maxine Carroll (Joan Blondell), wonders if he would rather solve a case than get married. When Maxine convinces the police captain (Clarence Kolb) to threaten Kenny with suspension, Kenny shows his dedication by accepting a case requiring him to dress as a woman. With a killer on the loose, Kenny must decide between his career obligations and his fiancée's wishes.

programme.title: Three for the Show
programme.desc: Widowed by World War I, a Broadway star remarries her late husband's songwriting partner only to have the first one turn up very much alive.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this iconic version of the famous play about a cash poor family who start to fray when they inherit a life insurance payout.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: Beyond the Sacramento
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor) save Lodestone from swindlers preparing a bond scam.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Last of the Redmen
programme.desc: A small group of ambushed white men (Jon Hall) is saved from slaughter by a selfless Mohican (Michael O'Shea).

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Riders of Black River
programme.desc: A former Texas Ranger's plans to marry are complicated by his future brother-in-law's involvement with cattle rustlers.

programme.title: The Outlaws Is Coming
programme.desc: Moe, Larry and Curly Joe (Adam West) bring their head-knocking, eye-gouging antics to the Wild West. When reporter Kenneth Cabot (Nancy Kovack) heads to Wyoming to stop the slaughter of buffaloes, he brings the stooges with him. There, they trade barbs with Billy the Kid, Jesse James and Wild Bill Hickock, while Cabot gets elected town sheriff. But they'll need some help from Annie Oakley (Mort Mills) when it comes to foiling the criminal plans of a land-hungry frontier villain.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: The Law vs. Billy the Kid
programme.desc: The notorious gunslinger’s new courtship with a rancher's lovely daughter is cut prematurely short when the law unexpectedly catches up with him.

programme.title: Riders of the Badlands
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger's uncanny resemblance to a wanted outlaw results in his own arrest by a fellow lawman.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: The Durango kid aims to break up Pop Ryland's gang of bank robbers but ends up saving the outlaw's son Tommy Ryland who has been marked for death.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: Law of the Canyon
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) bust a frontier protection racket.

programme.title: Beyond the Night
programme.desc: When a soldier's son reveals damning info about a local gangster's missing daughter, a war of attrition ensues.

programme.title: Love to Kill
programme.desc: The romance between a beautifully mysterious woman and a widower politician may become fatal if it turns out to be true that she’s a black widow.

programme.title: A Remarkable Life
programme.desc: There are many things in life that could do a number on a man's masculinity. Lenny Babbitt has his identity and manhood challenged when his wife Tracy leaves him for a female doctor named Iris who has been treating their autistic son Isaac.

programme.title: Hearts Under the Olive Tree
programme.desc: Looking for inspiration for her next fantasy book, a renowned author is taken to a farmland retreat, where something even more magical awaits.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: The Secrets of Comfort House
programme.desc: A multiple murder investigation in a small hunting town focuses on one suspect, Wendy Sinclair, who operates a battered women's shelter where each of the victims' wives have sought shelter.

programme.title: Just for Showmance
programme.desc: Tara marries Joe, a stranger as part of a TV show, but soon starts to fall for him after all.

programme.title: Falling For the Competition
programme.desc: A local mom’s and dad’s group clash for the prestigious Modern Parenting Group of the Year award.

programme.title: Cradle of Lies
programme.desc: Five years ago Melissa went into labor while in a coma. She has just awoken with no information about her baby girl, and so her frantic search begins.

programme.title: Eat, Love, London
programme.desc: Stella takes a job at a new London restaurant and ends up falling for the chef.

programme.title: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: The newfound fame of a cop who publishes her first novel is tainted by the specific details in the book that are the exact same as a real murder case.

programme.title: Crimes Of The Mind
programme.desc: A woman spends five years trying to get her brainwashed daughter back from a cult.

programme.title: Dance Together
programme.desc: An injured dancer and a shy Deaf girl overcome bullies, disability stigma, and other high school obstacles.

programme.title: Family in Hiding
programme.desc: A woman who told the FBI of a murder she witnessed has her family placed in Witness Protection, but a rogue agent just may reveal where they are.

programme.title: What Comes Around
programme.desc: A woman's past comes back to haunt her when the pimp she helped put behind bars is released and after revenge.

programme.title: The New Wife
programme.desc: It’s only been six months since Ruby Asher buried her husband and she’s already chasing a new, wealthy man—but her game doesn’t end with seduction.

programme.title: Blood Pressure
programme.desc: Nicole finds her life changed by a secret admirer's letters bearing lavish gifts and strange instructions.

programme.title: For the Love of Lily
programme.desc: A career-minded city girl must build a garden with a plant-loving country boy to appease her boss.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: It's the day of the Gamma Fair, but Sarah doesn't want to go. Bundy rescues Kappa Psi Psi's bachelorette auction, but pays for it later.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: Let Love Grow
programme.desc: Landscape architect Evie meets her match with new client Ryan, whose daughters are her biggest fan.

programme.title: JK's House
programme.desc: Life lessons and family drama are doled out in song and dance in this family-friendly musical about a single doctor raising a young family.

programme.title: Fatal Performance
programme.desc: When a struggling actress is hired to impersonate another woman at a business meeting, she soon finds out that her own real life is in danger.

programme.title: Inspiring Love
programme.desc: When Isla’s art unexpectedly sells to Mark, a second commission sees them falling in love.

programme.title: Campus Caller
programme.desc: When a college student goes missing, her ex-cop mother hunts for her and traces a path of bureaucracy and coverups all the way to the government.

programme.title: WWJD2 The Woodcarver
programme.desc: A troubled teenage boy helps an aging wood carver finish an impossibly difficult job.

programme.title: Cowboy & Indiana
programme.desc: With new found hope, former world champion bull rider is given a dangerous shot to regain his former glory.

programme.title: About Scout
programme.desc: A rebellious teen from the wrong side of the tracks convinces a wealthy mental patient to go on a road trip to find the sister her father took away.

programme.title: The Legend of Zu
programme.desc: 500 years after the great battle with the demons, Xiao He faces a resurrected Yu Qingzi.

programme.title: The Captain
programme.desc: When a commercial plane’s windshield shatters at 30,000 feet, a pilot makes the most miraculous landing in the history of modern Chinese aviation.

programme.title: Believer
programme.desc: In this electric crime thriller, a low-level drug dealer conspires with a dangerously ambitious cop to bring down a major cartel’s psychotic kingpin.

programme.title: Iceman
programme.desc: Four hundred years after being frozen, a Ming Dynasty palace guard and his associates are thawed in modern day to resume the battle they left behind.

programme.title: Iceman 2: The Time Traveler
programme.desc: Ying embarks on a quest for the only thing that can correct the wrongs of history.

programme.title: Dragon Squad
programme.desc: Interpol agents and gangsters battle in Hong Kong.

programme.title: Ip Man
programme.desc: A Japanese general challenges Chinese men to duels to prove the superiority of the Japanese.

programme.title: Ip Man 2
programme.desc: New in Hong Kong, Ip Man retaliates against his rivals' opposition to the Wing Chun fighting style.

programme.title: Ip Man 3
programme.desc: Hong Kong, 1959. A crooked real estate developer leads a band of gangsters in a property coup that can only be stopped by the Wing Chun grandmaster.

programme.title: Master Z: Ip Man Legacy
programme.desc: A martial arts expert is forced to abandon his reclusive lifestyle to combat a rising Chinese triad.

programme.title: Dragon Squad
programme.desc: Interpol agents and gangsters battle in Hong Kong.

programme.title: Ip Man
programme.desc: A Japanese general challenges Chinese men to duels to prove the superiority of the Japanese.

programme.title: Ip Man 2
programme.desc: New in Hong Kong, Ip Man retaliates against his rivals' opposition to the Wing Chun fighting style.

programme.title: Ip Man 3
programme.desc: Hong Kong, 1959. A crooked real estate developer leads a band of gangsters in a property coup that can only be stopped by the Wing Chun grandmaster.

programme.title: Master Z: Ip Man Legacy
programme.desc: A martial arts expert is forced to abandon his reclusive lifestyle to combat a rising Chinese triad.

programme.title: Along With The Gods: The Two Worlds
programme.desc: After a heroic death, a firefighter navigates the afterlife with the help of three guides.

programme.title: Along with the Gods: The Last 49 Days
programme.desc: A guardian helps a man through his trials, while his two colleagues help a former guardian on earth.

programme.title: Gintama
programme.desc: In 17th century feudal Tokyo, a young samurai struggles to keep his craft alive after extraterrestrials have invaded the land and outlawed all swords.

programme.title: Broken Sword Hero
programme.desc: Inspired by the story of a young runaway from Thailand's Ayutthaya period who grows up to be a legendary military general and fighter in Muay boxing.

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: A competitive Korean American arm wrestler goes to South Korea for a match only to discover that he has a sister he’d never been told about.

programme.title: Along With The Gods: The Two Worlds
programme.desc: After a heroic death, a firefighter navigates the afterlife with the help of three guides.

programme.title: Along with the Gods: The Last 49 Days
programme.desc: A guardian helps a man through his trials, while his two colleagues help a former guardian on earth.

programme.title: Hunchback of Notre Dame (1939)
programme.desc: As the Renaissance roils medieval France, the beauty of Esmeralda becomes an uncontrollable lure for four men.

programme.title: Julius Caesar
programme.desc: A conspiracy to assassinate Julius Caesar ignites a desperate struggle for power in this adaptation of William Shakespeare’s tragedy.

programme.title: The Goodbye Girl
programme.desc: After her ex leaves and subleases their apartment without warning, an ex-dancer forms an unlikely home with the new tenant, a quirky struggling actor.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: The Corn Is Green
programme.desc: Bette Davis stars as a schoolteacher determined to help the people of a turn-of-the-century Welsh mining town.

programme.title: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
programme.desc: Marjorie's engagement to WWI vet Bill faces trials and fidelity doubts, all set against a charming musical tribute to small-town American family life.

programme.title: Cabaret
programme.desc: A carefree American singer, a British academic, and a wealthy baron become involved in a complicated love triangle as Nazism rises in 1931 Berlin.

programme.title: The Devil Doll
programme.desc: A man opens a doll shop and begins to dispatch telepathically controlled shrunken people to kill his enemies.

programme.title: What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.title: Them!
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads to mutated giant ants that threaten mankind.

programme.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
programme.desc: After the devastating attack on Pearl Harbor, Lieutenant Colonel Jimmy Doolittle devises a plan for a daring raid to strike Japan.

programme.title: Ivanhoe
programme.desc: In a swashbuckling tale set in medieval England, a loyal knight risks everything to free his kidnapped king and win the honor of the woman he loves.

programme.title: It Happened on 5th Avenue
programme.desc: A hobo gets more company than usual one year amid his annual tradition of moving into a wealthy man's vacant New York mansion for the winter.

programme.title: Three Sailors and a Girl
programme.desc: Gordon MacRae, Gene Nelson, Jack E. Leonard, and Jane Powell star in one of the greatest movie musicals ever!

programme.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
programme.desc: A young woman and her husband strike it rich and become European celebrities, but after her Titanic survival, she becomes an international hero.

programme.title: Show Boat
programme.desc: A tale of music, bigotry and enduring love aboard a river Show Boat.

programme.title: Colt .45
programme.desc: A gun salesman falsely accused of theft and working with an outlaw gang must track down and retrieve a missing Colt .45s to clear his name.

programme.title: The Devil's Brother
programme.desc: Laurel and Hardy bumble their way into the heart of a classic comic opera filled with fearsome bandits.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Bounty (1962)
programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars as a first mate who leads his ship's exploited and abused crew through mutiny.

programme.title: Teahouse of the August Moon, The
programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars in this comedy about Americans who help build The Teahouse of the August Moon.

programme.title: On Moonlight Bay
programme.desc: After moving to Indiana, Marjorie Winfield begins a relationship with William Sherman, a young man who causes friction between her and her father.

programme.title: Susan Slept Here
programme.desc: A screenwriter and his wife take in a juvenile delinquent during the Christmas holidays, and neither is prepared for the turmoil that will come.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates when a psychology professor known for his controversial social experiments is found dead; Brennan works with Aubrey.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: In 1950s Hollywood, Brennan is an LAPD detective faced with sexism on the force, and Booth is a notorious jewel thief -- who is framed for murder.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Angela's psychic friend Avalon helps the team investigate when a psychic is found dead in the trunk of a tree; Booth and Brennan consider the pros and cons of Christine's imaginary friend.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates when a wealthy teacher is found dead in an abandoned bookstore; one of Brennan's interns teaches her to use Twitter.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby connects with a gifted young woman whose mental powers appear to rival or even surpass his own.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby is forced to use his telepathic abilities to keep himself and others alive when he becomes a hostage in a bank heist.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby struggles with Alvin Klein during his first official investigation: a 10-year-old murder.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: A performer's life is threatened, so Toby poses as her assistant and helps to investigate.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: An ex-con asks Horatio to help him find his missing son; Speedle investigates a man's death by asphyxia.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Marks on a female corpse on a beach lead Horatio to think the perpetrator is a serial killer who bites victims; Calleigh and Delko investigate a murder at a motel pool.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates when a fire engulfs a popular night club, killing 16 people and injuring 58 others.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team delves into "tweaker" culture after a brutal murder is followed by a near-fatal explosion at the home of a methamphetamine addict.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio witnesses a dramatic prison break and later discovers one of the escapees is a child molester/murderer he put away six months earlier.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A playboy who enjoys diplomatic immunity becomes Horatio's prime suspect after a model is killed in a hit-and-run accident during Fashion Week.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio delves into the world of modern treasure-hunting after a victim is found skewered to his yacht with a harpoon.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team finds a rape victim clinging to life after being beaten, and Horatio suspects an imprisoned rapist is somehow responsible for the attack.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU must determine the true cause and motive when several drowned people are discovered in the Las Vegas desert.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Three bodies bitten by humans and animals are found in a shallow grave; Garcia and Reid hide their preparation for a company fitness test from Morgan.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan's visit with a survivor of unusual stabbings in upstate New York leads to more questions about the case.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The discovery of two murder victims in West Virginia uncovers a long-simmering feud between two families.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a commonality when a series of target abductions take place; Savannah is frustrated with Morgan's traveling.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When people are killed by arsenic poisoning and handwritten death threats are found, the team pursues a suspect fascinated by Greek mythology; Hotch is worried about participating in a Career Day at Jack's school.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When prostitutes are murdered in Texas, their deaths seem to have religious overtones; members of the team are put at risk throughout the course of the investigation.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The investigation in Texas reveals a deep web of corruption; Garcia must save a friend.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates a series of murders with unidentifiable victims in Bakersfield, Calif.; agent Kate Callahan joins the team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team members search for a vengeful suspect who was once abused; Garcia travels to Texas to confront the person she shot.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team goes to Colorado to investigate when a passenger jet crashes; the incident reminds Kate of a family tragedy.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A body is found covered in scratches, leading the BAU to believe that the person responsible has a chronic skin disorder.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Navy captain who was searching for a priceless 200-year-old fleur-de-lis during the annual Louisiana Pirate Festival.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride, Sebastian and Tammy travel to South America after Pride is personally requested by a former colleague to assist with a classified operation that has been compromised.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Percy and Lasalle go under cover at a high-stakes poker game after the organizer targets players with access to a naval research laboratory; Laurel Pride visits her dad during spring break to discuss options after her upcoming graduation.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and his bar patrons are held hostage by a group of volatile thieves.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Gregorio calls on her former behavioral science professor when the team's latest case matches one she studied during FBI training.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A journalist posts a scathing article documenting Pride's "reckless use of justice"; the team is concerned about the fallout from the piece and the confidential information revealed; Rita Devereaux tells Pride it is a coordinated attack on him.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride assembles an off-the-books team to search for a loophole when he faces a grand jury indictment for abuse of power.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride's teams uncover a sinister plot during the New Orleans Tricentennial Fleet Week celebration.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Dr. Sweets deals with post traumatic stress after his subway train is derailed by flood water; a partially skeletonized body is discovered.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Recounting the events of the first case on which Brennan and Booth worked together; how other Jeffersonian team members' relationships began.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan returns to her former high school to investigate when unidentified human remains are discovered; Booth and Brennan pose as a married couple at her high school reunion.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth are asked to identify human remains found inside the belly of a shark; a marine biologist (Rena Sofer) is interested in Booth.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan investigate a death at a rock `n' roll fantasy camp.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a cabin in the woods burns down, the bodies of two witches are revealed; Angela and Hodgins are arrested.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Everyone at the Jeffersonian tries to uncover forensic evidence to help elicit a conviction in the trial of the Gravedigger.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The remains of a hoarder are discovered; Angela's father (Billy Gibbons) visits; Booth and Brennan are each confronted with unique opportunities.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team helps Cam solve the case of an unidentified boy; after making personal discoveries, the members of the team realize they belong in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The remains of a couple are found in a cave; Brennan re-evaluates her relationship with Booth when his girlfriend makes a surprise visit.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Officers respond after a fleeing suspect opens fire; officers respond to a large fight; officers pursue a vehicle that crashes and flips; officers investigate a reported assault involving a minor.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A gang banger is caught using his cell phone to sell prescription drugs; a woman accused of assaulting her husband claims it's a lie; two out-of-control cousins spend time in isolation after physically threatening officers.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A young inmate is devastated when officers tell him he killed someone while driving drunk; a woman charged with a DUI demonstrates how she "rocked" her field sobriety test.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: Life Inside
programme.desc: This documentary takes a look at the friendship that NFL player Aaron Hernandez formed with Sheriff Thomas Hodgson while he was in prison.

programme.title: O.J. Simpson: Blood, Lies & Murder
programme.desc: Tom Lange, the LAPD lead detective on the O.J. Simpson double murder case, discusses evidence that was left out of trial by the prosecution; a look at Tom Lange's personal 450-page journal and photos and videos from firsthand participants.

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Aaron Hernandez's early career success was shockingly overshadowed by his violent life as a killer.

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Timothy McVeigh, a decorated American veteran, masterminded the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing.

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Known only as the Unibomber, Ted Kaczynski terrorized the country with a string of bombings.

programme.title: Green River Killer: I Met My Sister's Killer
programme.desc: The Green River Killer was convicted of murdering dozens of women. The sister of one of his victims confronts him in prison, hoping for answers.

programme.title: The Preppy Killer: My Friend the Murderer
programme.desc: Margo Manhattan discusses her friend Robert Chambers—the so-called Preppy Killer—and shares never-before-scene photos from his high school days.

programme.title: Capturing Chris Watts
programme.desc: Police bodycam and surveillance footage illustrates the action behind the real-life investigation into Chris Watts, who pleaded for help to find his wife and daughters, only to be accused of their murders.

programme.title: Scott Peterson: Ultimate Betrayal
programme.desc: Following the murder of Laci Peterson, who was eight months pregnant when she disappeared, her husband Scott Peterson is convicted of the crime.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A frustrated inmate pays a price for giving officers a piece of his mind; the jail chaplain reaches out to a crying prisoner; a disorderly Canadian woman demands to be released from her "U.S. oppressors."

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A former Green Beret becomes involved in prostitution; a domestic violence suspect threatens authorities; a woman who works as a dental hygienist by day, stripper by night.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A would-be rock star brought in on drug charges shows off his vocal skills; officers refuse a volatile woman's plea for beer.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: An inmate serenades guards with a guitar solo; a married couple is charged with passing a bogus prescription; a novice pot farmer gets busted after being stopped by police for a traffic violation.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Officers search for a missing teenager; officers respond to a neighbor dispute; officers pursue a vehicle that crashes; officers discover many items of concern while searching a vehicle.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Officers respond after a fleeing suspect opens fire; officers respond to a large fight; officers pursue a vehicle that crashes and flips; officers investigate a reported assault involving a minor.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A gang banger is caught using his cell phone to sell prescription drugs; a woman accused of assaulting her husband claims it's a lie; two out-of-control cousins spend time in isolation after physically threatening officers.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A young inmate is devastated when officers tell him he killed someone while driving drunk; a woman charged with a DUI demonstrates how she "rocked" her field sobriety test.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: Life Inside
programme.desc: This documentary takes a look at the friendship that NFL player Aaron Hernandez formed with Sheriff Thomas Hodgson while he was in prison.

programme.title: O.J. Simpson: Blood, Lies & Murder
programme.desc: Tom Lange, the LAPD lead detective on the O.J. Simpson double murder case, discusses evidence that was left out of trial by the prosecution; a look at Tom Lange's personal 450-page journal and photos and videos from firsthand participants.

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Aaron Hernandez's early career success was shockingly overshadowed by his violent life as a killer.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Richland County, SC officers pursue a vehicle and Wilkes-Barre, PA officers are called after a man crashes a private fundraiser. Nye County, NV officers respond to a fight while officers in Berkeley County, SC are called to a bar for a noise complaint that ends with a woman being detained for public disorderly conduct.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Berkeley County, SC officers and K9 pursue a suspect that fled on foot while Beech Grove, IN officers respond to a disturbance at a hotel. Richland County, SC officers are called to a large out of control gathering and Daytona Beach, FL officers search for a suspect that fled on foot after a vehicle pursuit.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: A Daytona Beach traffic stop turns into a search after someone flees; Wilkes-Barre officers investigate a hit-and-run.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: A Richland County investigation leads to a barricaded suspect; Wilkes-Barre officers respond to a man with a weapon.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Wilkes-Barre officers respond to an erratic driver; Daytona Beach officers respond to a man barricaded in his room.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Beech Grove officers find a gun hidden in bushes; Daytona Beach officers search for a suspect who crashed while fleeing.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Toledo, Ohio, officers pursue a vehicle in a carjacking and search for the suspects after they flee.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Officers investigate a hit and run accident where the suspect is accused of escaping the scene in a different car; officers rush to assist a fellow officer struggling with a subject; officers investigate stalking allegations.

programme.title: On Patrol: Live
programme.desc: Officers search for a suspect who fled after a domestic incident; officers investigate a shooting in a residential neighborhood; officers confront an alligator after reports from concerned citizens; a dispute at a convenience store.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Steve works turning a rusted-out 1956 Willys truck into a BBQ kitchen-on-wheels; Bodie and his son transform a mini-Divco milk truck kiddie car from the 1960s into a souped-up go-kart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: An 1881 potbelly stove whips into the shop; the guys are challenged to restore a 1940s children's Irish mail cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1952 powerboat ride splashes into the shop; Rick tackles a 1940s child's tricycle for a Las Vegas museum.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1940s carnival car enters the shop; a returning customer brings in a 1960s Schwinn bicycle to be restored.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1972 Honda ATC is brought into the shop; Ron and Tyler plan Rick's bachelor bash.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny builds an extra special car for a customer who wants something no one else has--a tribute car of the rare Yenko Nova.

programme.desc: Rygaard Logging is trying to get back on track with the help of patriarch Craig Rygaard; the Swampman's under the gun to build an emergency treetop storm shelter; David Zitterkopf's son Levi gets a crucial lesson in logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard pushes his crew to a breaking point; Gary and Eddie blow up their business to cash in on green gold; David Zitterkopf could see his family empire fall to pieces, with one wrong move; a mutiny is underway among the Chapman crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As Papac Alaska goes deeper into their seven thousand acre site, Joe and Coatsy devise a plan of attack for the next section of this massive project; Rygaard Logging is fighting to get the wood out; Gary and Eddie need to step up their game.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Papac crew is moving on to the most remote and treacherous site of their season; the money is drying up for Greg Chapman and his crew is seeing red; Gary and Eddie's new venture is becoming a nightmare.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Papac has to step in as Joe and Coatsey's arguments threaten to bring the job to a grinding halt; David Zitterkopf's back to work after an injury that threatened to end his season.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A storm's brewing over the Swamp Man and it's threatening to wash away his hopes of filling a huge order; Gabe deals with the aftermath of Aiden's mutiny; the Chapman crew's behind after they burned through their money chasing the Lost Logging Train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, three generations of Rygaard loggers are fighting for the crown; Papack Alaska Logging moves into their final section; Gary and Eddie see if their swamp logging gamble has paid off.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac Logging is barely holding onto their lead; the Rygaards will have to work as a team if they're gonna reclaim the title; Shelby Stanga's under the gun, but has a secret map to a possible stash of sunken logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Industry titans Pihl Logging and Rygaard Logging tackle some of their most challenging jobs yet; Frank Harkness makes a name for himself; Buckin' Billy Ray takes to the treetops of Vancouver Island, risking his life to keep other people safe.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Cruising along the California coastline, the guys know they're in for something big. Mil Blair founded the iconic motorcycle magazine Easyriders.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A man moves his collection to a motel in North Carolina; Frank gambles on a pricey samurai artifact; an old Harley-Davidson dealership, Gerald's one-man town.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank takes a gamble on a set of vintage wheels; the guys uncover a flying saucer and a larger-than-life Popeye.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find themselves waist deep in Kenny's ragtag collection; a man's stockpile is so large that he keeps it in an old school; a pair of muskets that could be centuries old; the guys pick in Mike's hometown.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A visit to a Kentucky property with a racetrack revives a rivalry between Mike and Frank; a stop in North Carolina looks like a bust until the guys unearth a one-of-a-kind TV relic.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike comes across a 150-year-old Martin guitar; a rifle-toting homeowner's property is off limits until the guys do some fast talking; Danielle gets a vintage Indian motor appraised.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys discover "Forevertron" in Wisconsin; a spare parts collection; a general store has been closed for 60 years.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a big business decision must be made affecting Duck Commander, Willie plans an employee retreat.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dying his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis. Jase's help turns into a competition amongst the Robertson brothers to see who is most fit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from--Godwin's House.

programme.desc: The shop's next challenge is a 1967 Chevelle with a Great 8 pedigree.
