programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man riding a bicycle was fatally injured, and police believed he was the victim of a hit-and-run accident. Tiny clues found at the scene created a picture of the vehicle which struck him and led police to its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a pipe bomb ripped through a rural home, police had no idea who was responsible. A lot number on a 9-volt battery and the remnants of a mailing label found on a hard drive led investigators to who sent the bomb and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in St. Petersburg, Florida, crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the Amtrak Railroad experienced the deadliest train crash in United States history when the Sunset Limited derailed while crossing Alabama's Big Bayou Canot bridge. Forty-seven passengers and crew were killed; scores more were injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1962, the people of the small town of Hanford, California lost their sense of peace when one of their own, 15-year-old Marlene Miller, was murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Haunted by the disappearance of her mother, a young woman undertook an investigation of her own. Her mother's diary was in the cold case file; there, she discovered a dark family secret, which might have been the reason her mother vanished.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1986, Kathleen Lipscomb's body was found on a deserted road outside of San Antonio. Months passed, then years, and the crime was never solved. Then Kathleen's family hired a private investigator, who discovered her diary.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For seven years, a trio of men robbed one bank after another. They always got away before the police arrived, and they left no evidence behind. But the way they stood and the clothes they wore told a story that could be read by forensic scientists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 19-year-old woman was found dead in her car; the scene had been staged to make murder appear to be suicide. During their investigation, police discovered the victim was involved in a love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's death in Pennsylvania triggers a homicide investigation into another woman's death in North Carolina. The similarities in the cases were striking, and examiners must determine if the suspect's story about accidental drowning is all wet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, a 12-year-old was found murdered in her home and it changed the feeling of security residents had in the small town of Waseca, Minnesota. Despite a meticulous search of the home and an exhaustive investigation, police had no suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1989, 4-year-old April Loveless was found dead in the backyard of her Texas home. Her mother Debbie Loveless and step-father John Miller told police that she was attacked and killed by the family dogs. Investigators did not agree.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Detectives learn that a genetic disorder caused the deaths of a woman's children, resulting in an overturned conviction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This examination of the role an autopsy plays in a murder investigation focuses on the suspicious 1997 death of Georgia resident Virginia Ridley. Police charged her mentally unstable husband Alan with murder, but a medical examiner discovered that she died of natural causes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 17-month-old Josh Hinson died in a fire which a federal agency ruled was intentionally set by Josh's mother Terri Strickland. Using the then-emerging resources of the Internet, Terri Strickland undertook her own investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl went missing from her Colorado home, and the only evidence¾the kidnapper¾left behind was three fingerprints on a window screen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Edward Honaker was convicted of rape, sodomy and aggravated sexual battery; he was sentenced to three life terms in prison. Honaker steadfastly maintained his innocence. After years in prison and writing countless letters, he finally found someone who believed him, and was willing to pay for DNA testing which could prove he was telling the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident; it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Scientists and detectives use DNA to solve a string of rapes and murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Sheila Bryan, who was convicted of killing her mother in a car fire, is granted a new trial. An expert fire witness's opinion on how the fire ignited differs from the prosecution's theory. If verified, it would clear Bryan of any culpability.

programme.desc: In 1990, Shirley Andronowich's body was found one morning after being brutally murdered and mutilated in Winnipeg, Manitoba. programme.desc: Susie Mowbray was charged for her husband Bill Mowbray's death. Her son was so convinced of her innocence that he enrolled in law school, studied all of the evidence and, eventually, discovered the truth of what really happened between his parents.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In August 2013, Omaha residents are sent into an all-out panic when four victims are tragically found dead days apart. Soon after, Omaha native Nikko Jenkins is arrested, exposing a violent serial killer that a flawed system helped to create.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: Beloved Wilkes-Barre DJ Mike Onley used his celebrity status to encourage peace among the masses. But when he�s killed in a seemingly random crime, his murder sends shockwaves throughout the city and ignites a decades long fight to find justice.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: Stanley "Tookie" Williams. A name that goes hand in hand with the origin and rise of the infamous Crips street gang. By the late 70's he became the most powerful member of The Crips, helping to shed massive blood shed and terror throughout South Central Los Angeles and beyond. A ruthless and intimidating body builder Williams could take on any enemy but his escalating addiction to drugs proved to be a beast that he could never conquer. Then in 1979 he was convicted of four counts of murder and sentenced to death. While on death row earning millions, to deal cocaine on the side? How does an Olympic gold medalist and elite pro fighter end up writing bad checks? What drives the rich and famous to commit unspeakable atrocities against their loved ones?

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: After young parents-to-be are gunned down in Memphis, police are shocked to learn their deaths resulted from a vengeful dispute over bundles of hair. While certain they have their killer, the road to justice proves trickier than first thought.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: Police discover a troubling motive when a Connecticut man is badly burned by a gas-fueled blaze, and his wife claims he started the fire during a diabetic delirium.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: The first chapter of a storybook life begins with Washington resident Leon Baucham landing the woman of his dreams. But with the turn of a page, a fairy tale yields to darkness. When Leon is found dead in the reeds off a backcountry road, a single gunshot wound in his back, a community is left to puzzle out how a man who seemed to have it all could meet so cruel an end.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When 20-year-old honor student Cathy Torrez doesn�t return to her Southern California home after her shift at a local drugstore, her mother immediately suspects something is amiss. But it�s not until her body is found a week later that police begin to dig into her private life, looking at boyfriends past and present, in hopes of finding a killer.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When book smart, Amber Reeve�s jailhouse romance turns deadly she must decide if her newfound love is worth more than her freedom. Later, beauty queen, Kumari Fulbright�s, dream of becoming a lawyer crumbles when a dangerous love triangle unravels.

programme.title: For My Man

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: Stanley "Tookie" Williams. A name that goes hand in hand with the origin and rise of the infamous Crips street gang. By the late 70's he became the most powerful member of The Crips, helping to shed massive blood shed and terror throughout South Central Los Angeles and beyond. A ruthless and intimidating body builder Williams could take on any enemy but his escalating addiction to drugs proved to be a beast that he could never conquer. Then in 1979 he was convicted of four counts of murder and sentenced to death. While on death row earning millions, to deal cocaine on the side? How does an Olympic gold medalist and elite pro fighter end up writing bad checks? What drives the rich and famous to commit unspeakable atrocities against their loved ones?

programme.desc: Chris Lighty was a giant in the entertainment world. As President and co-founder of Violator Management, he helmed the careers of superstars like 50 Cent, P. Diddy, Mariah Carey and many more. And his branding and advertising expertise helped clients like A Tribe Called Quest and 50 Cent score lucrative multi-million dollar commercials with Sprite and Vitamin Water. But while he had corporate success, street beefs still haunted him. A war between his client 50 Cent and The Game resulted in murder, assaults and people trying to kill Lighty himself. But it wouldn�t be rap beef that would eventually end his life. While police ruled his death a suicide, friends and family say he was the victim of foul play. For the first time ever on TV, those closest to him explain just what happened to Chris Lighty.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Today we are hopping down to South America to check out some of the coolest creatures on Earth. Animals featured include the parrot, the sea lion, the tapir, the iguana, and more!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at ways scientists are measuring the health of our forests. In New England, Philippe visits a white pine forest that is being threatened by invasive plants. At the University of California - Santa Cruz, students use sonic-tomography to look inside trees in order to detect any signs of disease. At the Pine Barrens of New Jersey, we learn about the pitch pine tree.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted world wide.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We head to a winter wonderland in Banff, Alberta, Canada. Philippe joins the avalanche safety team at Ski Lake Louise as they show a few different ways of avalanche control including dynamite blasts on the mountain. We then head to the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise for a snowshoeing expedition. And finally we look at the dynamics of ice while climbing a frozen waterfall.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We look at different examples of cultural science. Starting off in Hawaii, Philippe paddles out on a 6-man canoe during a lesson in early Hawaiian navigation. Then it's off to Florida to join members of the Seminole tribe who show us different uses of plants as tools and food in the harsh terrain of the everglades. We wrap things up in the Pacific Northwest looking at the Suquamish tribe.

programme.desc: J.R. Ewing finally meets his end. The family strives to set aside their differences and mourn together. Accompanied by many characters from J.R.'s past, the Ewings bury their own.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Bobby, Christopher and John Ross work on J.R.'s masterpiece. J.R.'s will has lasting effects on the family legacy. Sue Ellen tries to get Gary (TED SHACKELFORD) out of Dallas.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela's mother, Afton Cooper (AUDREY LANDERS), returns to Dallas. Emma is put in the middle of her father and grandmother's relationship, pushing her closer to Drew.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: The Ewings' investigation of a conspiracy continuing to blame Christopher for recent events brings revelations in line with J.R.'s masterpiece. A new adversary is added to the mix.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: After Cliff (KEN KERCHEVAL) and Ryland put Ewing Energies on the verge of collapse, the Ewings battle back. Christopher gets closer to finding his mother.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross lets Pamela in on J.R.'s master plan, but his trust may be misplaced. Drew confides a dark secret to Elena, forcing her to choose between her family and Christopher.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross and Pamela make a shocking discovery about an enemy's location the night J.R. was killed, compelling Bobby to reveal more of J.R.'s master plan. LEE MAJORS guest stars.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the electrifying second season finale, the Ewings unite to execute J.R.'s master plan and the shocking answer to the question "Who killed J.R.?" is finally revealed.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: The third season begins with the Ewings on top, having vanquished Cliff Barnes (KEN KERCHEVAL). But solidarity can only last for so long, and conflicts arise.

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people – and dozens of hours of news footage — Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One vacation. Two teens. Thousands of text messages. What sounds like the beginnings of a typical modern romance turns to tragedy–and controversy–for a coastal Massachusetts town.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: This episode chronicles the history and unsung heroes from communities around the country. From science to the skies, these local legends inspire others to follow their lead, ensuring that they’re never forgotten.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Los Angeles to see how a shelter organization is meeting the mental health needs of the unhoused. Plus, is the concept of imposter syndrome masking inequity in the workplace? And, South Arkansas residents express their hopes and concerns about lithium mining in their town.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Escaping The Blade

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: A show first! A woman and her boyfriend each try their hand at Frank Nicotero's trivia questions to see who can win the most money.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee

programme.title: Eat Play Stay

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Vegan delights, putt-putt, stand-up comedy and more on two cheap dates in New Orleans.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms can’t take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Explore the lives of extraordinary seniors who don't let age define them. From setting records to achieving lifelong dreams, this episode of Stitch celebrates those continuing to push the boundaries and pursue passions in their golden years.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: This episode chronicles the history and unsung heroes from communities around the country. From science to the skies, these local legends inspire others to follow their lead, ensuring that they’re never forgotten.

programme.title: Truly Santa Fe
programme.desc: Join host Amanda Machon for a day of unforgettable adventure in Santa Fe, New Mexico! Alongside special guests, Amanda celebrates The Land of Enchantment, showcasing everything from world-class museums and restaurants to thrilling outdoor excursions.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1977, people across Pittsburgh live in fear as a string of brutal killings sends detectives on a chase to catch the shotgun slayer. He invades homes and senselessly attacks with a shotgun, knives and hammers in the dead of night.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: What strange snack did a woman eat at a football game? What ice cream flavor was inspired by a hot dog topping? Frank Nicotero is asking these questions and more, as Cincinnati locals try to win cash prizes.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A look at daring escapes from custody and the breakouts that take on many forms – yet always involve finding and exploiting the weakest parts of the system.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: In honor of Pittsburgh's love of handhelds, Chef Claudy Pierre and Chef Alex Brown get creative crafting their best sandwich-inspired dishes.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: KISS-FM radio host, Alley Faith joins Greg to explore places that put Milwaukee on the map. They visit the Harley Davidson Museum, a unique cheese creamery and ring the bell with Mayor Cavalier Johnson atop what was once the world's tallest building.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Nigerian-born Phd student Melvin hopes that finding love in Cincinnati is not as hard as rocket science, and he’s about to experiment with three blind dates. Three Cincy ladies will try to win him over with bowling, cupcake making and rock climbing.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Don't miss this high-flying adventure, as Amanda meets up with renaissance woman, Leah Black. Together, they soar the skies above ABQ, rock out with the future of music, and make great beer for a good cause.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: A car or the T might be the typical way to travel, but Rob’s on a mission to explore some of the more unique modes of transport the Boston area’s got to offer.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A fugitive escapes through the ceiling. A man plows his car into the police station. These shocking stories prove cops don't even have to leave the building to encounter the unpredictable.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes exploiting online generosity are a growing trend. These real-life stories show people going to great lengths to con unsuspecting donors out of their money.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day try their hand at pottery and make pretzels in a 150 year old oven before toasting their day at Carson Street Deli & Craft Beer Bar in the Southside.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Let a naughty mermaid be your guide to a finger-licking, dune-humping, lobster-rolling, ghost-hunting good time in this charming and historic seaside community. This is The Cape.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Maverick Meyers is a shy 17 year old gamer who spends 8 hours a day on his self-built computer. Kinga meets Maverick in Clermont, Florida to take him out of his comfort zone on an outing he’ll never forget.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: In Orlando, our local experts tell you where to devour hummingbird cake, quench your thirst with an intoxicating fish bowl, and find the best bathrooms. These ‘City Beautiful’ experts know which spots are worth your time.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Can Chef Colton Colburn-Wood of Cosmica in Boston trip up Chef Erin Miller of Urban Hearth in Cambridge? Both chefs skillfully build simple to complex foundations. But who will correctly replicate and get theirs plated in time?

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: 60 Min Documentaries
programme.desc: A playlist of hour long VL Originals

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are social media influencers who have nothing but love for Sacramento. Join them as they explore the heart and soul of the city through incredible activities, hidden gems, amazing eats and the locals who make Sactown so special.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Los Angeles to see how a shelter organization is meeting the mental health needs of the unhoused. Plus, is the concept of imposter syndrome masking inequity in the workplace? And, South Arkansas residents express their hopes and concerns about lithium mining in their town.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to America’s Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Finding Adventure

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
